greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table T(n,k) = reciprocal of k-th number prime to n, modulo n, for 1 <= k <= phi(n).
comment: T(n,k) = smallest m such that A038566(n,k) * m = 1 (mod n).
For n>1 every row begins with 1 and ends with n-1.  T(n,k) = A038566(n,k)^(phi(n) - 1) (mod n). - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Jan 03 2015
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10060
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Modular Inverse
formula: T(n,k) * A038566(n,k) = 1 (mod n), for n >=1 and k=1..A000010(n). - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 06 2016
maple: 0,seq(seq(i^(-1) mod m, i = select(t->igcd(t,m)=1, [$1..m-1])),m=1..100); # _Robert Israel_, May 18 2014
mathematica: Table[nn = n; a = Select[Range[nn], CoprimeQ[#, nn] &];
xref: Cf. A124223, A102057, A038566, A000010 (row lengths), A023896 (row sums after first)
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Oct 20 2006
